50#ifndef AM_HAL_FLASH_H
51#define AM_HAL_FLASH_H

56#endif

58#include <stdint.h>

61//*****************************************************************************
62//
64//
65//*****************************************************************************
66#define AM_HAL_FLASH_PROGRAM_KEY 0x12344321
67#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_KEY 0xD894E09E
68
69
70
71//*****************************************************************************
72//
74//
75//*****************************************************************************
76#define AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR SRAM_BASEADDR
77#define AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_SIZE (384 * 1024)
78#define AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR (AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR + AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_SIZE - 1)
79#define AM_HAL_FLASH_DTCM_START AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR
80#define AM_HAL_FLASH_DTCM_END (AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR + (64 * 1024) - 1)
81
82//*****************************************************************************
83//
85//
86//*****************************************************************************
87#define AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR 0x00000000
88#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INSTANCE_SIZE ( 512 * 1024 )
89#define AM_HAL_FLASH_NUM_INSTANCES 2
90#define AM_HAL_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE ( 8 * 1024 )
91#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIZE AM_HAL_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE
92#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INSTANCE_PAGES ( AM_HAL_FLASH_INSTANCE_SIZE / AM_HAL_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE )
93#define AM_HAL_FLASH_TOTAL_SIZE ( AM_HAL_FLASH_INSTANCE_SIZE * AM_HAL_FLASH_NUM_INSTANCES )
94#define AM_HAL_FLASH_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR ( AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR + AM_HAL_FLASH_TOTAL_SIZE - 1 )
95#define AM_HAL_FLASH_APPL_ADDR 0xC000
96
97//
100//
101#define ISADDRSRAM(x) ((x >= AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_ADDR) && \
102 (x <= (AM_HAL_FLASH_SRAM_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR & ~0x3)))
103#if AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR == 0x0
104#define ISADDRFLASH(x) (x <= (AM_HAL_FLASH_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR & ~0x3))
105#else
106#define ISADDRFLASH(x) ((x >= AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR) && \
107 (x <= (AM_HAL_FLASH_LARGEST_VALID_ADDR & ~0x3)))
108#endif
109
110//
112//
113#define AM_HAL_FLASH_ROW_WIDTH_BYTES (512)
114
115//
117//
118#define AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR2INST(addr) ( ( addr >> 19 ) & (AM_HAL_FLASH_NUM_INSTANCES - 1) )
119
120//
122//
123#define AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR2PAGE(addr) ( ( addr >> 13 ) & 0x3F )
124
125//
127//
128#define AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR2ABSPAGE(addr) ( addr >> 13 )
129
130//*****************************************************************************
131//
145//
146//*****************************************************************************
147#define CYCLESPERITER (AM_HAL_CLKGEN_FREQ_MAX_MHZ / 3)
148#define FLASH_CYCLES_US(n) ((n * CYCLESPERITER) + 0)
149#define FLASH_CYCLES_US_NOCACHE(n) ( (n == 0) ? 0 : (n * CYCLESPERITER) - 5)
150
151//
153//
154#define am_hal_flash_program_otp am_hal_flash_program_info
155#define am_hal_flash_program_otp_sram am_hal_flash_program_info_sram
156
157//*****************************************************************************
158//
163//
164//*****************************************************************************
165typedef struct am_hal_flash_helper_struct
166{
167 //
168 // The basics.
169 //
170 int (*flash_mass_erase)(uint32_t, uint32_t);
171 int (*flash_page_erase)(uint32_t, uint32_t, uint32_t);
172 int (*flash_program_main)(uint32_t, uint32_t *, uint32_t *, uint32_t);
173 int (*flash_program_info_area)(uint32_t, uint32_t, uint32_t *, uint32_t, uint32_t);
174
175 //
176 // Non-blocking variants, but be careful these are not interrupt safe so
177 // mask interrupts while these very long operations proceed.
178 //
179 int (*flash_mass_erase_nb)(uint32_t, uint32_t);
180 int (*flash_page_erase_nb)(uint32_t, uint32_t, uint32_t);
181 int (*flash_page_erase2_nb)( uint32_t value, uint32_t address);
182 bool (*flash_nb_operation_complete)(void);
183
184 //
185 // Useful utilities.
186 //
187 uint32_t (*flash_util_read_word)( uint32_t *);
188 void (*flash_util_write_word)( uint32_t *, uint32_t);
189 void (*bootrom_delay_cycles)(uint32_t ui32Cycles);
190
191 //
192 // Essentially these are recovery options.
193 //
194 int (*flash_info_erase)( uint32_t, uint32_t);
195 int (*flash_info_plus_main_erase)( uint32_t, uint32_t);
196 int (*flash_info_plus_main_erase_both)( uint32_t value);
197 int (*flash_recovery)( uint32_t value);
198
199 //
200 // The following functions pointers will generally never be called from
201 // user programs. They are here primarily to document these entry points
202 // which are usable from a debugger or debugger script.
203 //
204 void (*flash_program_main_from_sram)(void);
205 void (*flash_program_info_area_from_sram)(void);
206 void (*flash_erase_main_pages_from_sram)(void);
207 void (*flash_mass_erase_from_sram)(void);
208 void (*flash_info_erase_from_sram)(void);
209 void (*flash_info_plus_main_erase_from_sram)(void);
210 void (*flash_nb_operation_complete_from_sram)(void);
211 void (*flash_page_erase2_nb_from_sram)(void);
212 void (*flash_recovery_from_sram)(void);
213
214} g_am_hal_flash_t;
215extern const g_am_hal_flash_t g_am_hal_flash;
216
217//*****************************************************************************
218//
220//
221//*****************************************************************************
222#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR 0x50020000
223#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_O 0x10
224#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_WRITPROT_O 0x40
225#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_COPYPROT_O 0x50
226
227#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ADDR (AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR + AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_O)
228#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_WRITPROT_ADDR (AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR + AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_WRITPROT_O)
229#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_COPYPROT_ADDR (AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR + AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_COPYPROT_O)
230#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CUST_TRIM_ADDR (AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR + 0x14)
231
232//
236//
237#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE0 0x48EAAD88
238#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE1 0xC9705737
239#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE2 0x0A6B8458
240#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SIGNATURE3 0xE41A9D74
241
242//
244//
245#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_DEBUGGERPROT_S 0
246#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SWOCTRL_S 1
247#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SRAMWIPE_S 2
248#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_FLASHWIPE_S 3
249#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOPRGM_S 4
250#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOERASE_S 8
251#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_BOOTLOADERSPIN_S 9
252
253#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_DEBUGGERPROT_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_DEBUGGERPROT_S))
254#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SWOCTRL_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SWOCTRL_S))
255#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SRAMWIPE_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_SRAMWIPE_S))
256#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_FLASHWIPE_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_FLASHWIPE_S))
257#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOPRGM_M ((uint32_t)(0xF << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOPRGM_S))
258#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOERASE_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_ENINFOERASE_S))
259#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_BOOTLOADERSPIN_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_BOOTLOADERSPIN_S))
260#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_DEEPSLEEP_M ((uint32_t)(0x1 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_BOOTLOADERSPIN_S))
261#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_DEEPSLEEP ((uint32_t)(0x0 << AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_SECURITY_BOOTLOADERSPIN_S))
262
263//
268//
269#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CHUNKSIZE (16*1024)
270
271#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CHUNK2ADDR(n) (AM_HAL_FLASH_ADDR + (n << 14))
272#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_CHUNK2INST(n) ((n >> 5) & 1
273#define AM_HAL_FLASH_INFO_ADDR2CHUNK(n) ((n) >> 14)
